question: Can I get a mortgage if my annual income is $75,000 and I have a credit score of 700?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 35%, you are eligible. Typical down payment 5-20%.

steps.content: Can I get a mortgage if my annual income is $75,000 and I have a credit score of 700?
Plan: 1) Consult home_loan_agent for eligibility. 2) Engage credit_agent for score validation. 3) Use calculator for DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final response.
Gathering information on mortgage eligibility requirements.
Eligibility generally requires a minimum credit score of 620 and a debt-to-income ratio under 43%.
Credit score of 700 is well above the minimum required 620.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio assuming standard debts.
Debt-to-income ratio calculated as 35%, which is within acceptable limits.
What should I prepare for the down payment?
Fetching information on down payment requirements.
Down payments typically range from 5-20% depending on the loan program.
All checks have been verified and approved.
Is there anything else I should know?
Ensure to have necessary documents ready for the application process.
Yes, with a credit score of 700 and DTI of 35%, you are eligible. Typical down payment 5-20%.
